com.fasterxml.util.membuf

Class Segment<S extends Segment<S>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fasterxml.util.membuf.Segment<S>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SegmentBase

    public abstract class Segment<S extends Segment<S>>
extends Object
    Core definition of containers for individual segments that form physical storage level of the logical queue. Note that at this level we don't yet know either physical primitive type used under the hood (from byte to long) or underlying storage method (array, ByteBuffer). All lengths are in units of fundamental primitive value (i.e. single byte for byte-valued segments; units of 8 bytes for long-valued and so on)

    Type parameter is recursive due to having to return 'this' for call chaining.

    Author:
    Tatu Saloranta

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Segment.State
      Enumeration listing usual states a segment can be in.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract int availableForAppend()
      How many primitive values (of type segment contains) can still fit within this segment?
      abstract int availableForReading()
      How many primitive values (of type segment contains) could be read from this segment?
      abstract void clear()
      Method that will erase any content segment may have and reset various pointers: will be called when clearing buffer, the last remaining segment needs to be cleared.
      abstract S finishReading()
      Method called when all contents has been read from this segment.
      abstract S finishWriting()
      Method called when writes to this segment have been completed, which occurs when segment is full, more content is to be written, and another segment is becoming the active write-segment.
      abstract S getNext()
      Accessor for getting the next segment in linked list.
      abstract S initForReading()
      Method called when the segment becomes the active read segment.
      abstract S initForWriting()
      Method called when the segment becomes the active write segment.
      abstract void markFree()
      Method that will forcibly mark segment as free; should only be called when releasing segment to an allocator.
      abstract S relink(S next)
      Method for defining next segment in linked list
      abstract int skip(int length)
      Method for trying to skip up to specified number of bytes.
      abstract Segment.State state()

    • Method Detail

      • availableForAppend

        public abstract int availableForAppend()
        How many primitive values (of type segment contains) can still fit within this segment?

      • availableForReading

        public abstract int availableForReading()
        How many primitive values (of type segment contains) could be read from this segment?

      • initForWriting

        public abstract S initForWriting()
        Method called when the segment becomes the active write segment.

        This state transition must occur from Segment.State.FREE.

      • finishWriting

        public abstract S finishWriting()
        Method called when writes to this segment have been completed, which occurs when segment is full, more content is to be written, and another segment is becoming the active write-segment.

      • initForReading

        public abstract S initForReading()
        Method called when the segment becomes the active read segment. Its state may or may not change, but we do need to create the reader-wrapper for ByteBuffer

      • finishReading

        public abstract S finishReading()
        Method called when all contents has been read from this segment. Will return next segment and clear it.
        Returns:
        Next segment after this segment (before clearing link)

      • clear

        public abstract void clear()
        Method that will erase any content segment may have and reset various pointers: will be called when clearing buffer, the last remaining segment needs to be cleared.

      • markFree

        public abstract void markFree()
        Method that will forcibly mark segment as free; should only be called when releasing segment to an allocator.
        Since:
        0.9.1

      • relink

        public abstract S relink(S next)
        Method for defining next segment in linked list

      • getNext

        public abstract S getNext()
        Accessor for getting the next segment in linked list.

      • skip

        public abstract int skip(int length)
        Method for trying to skip up to specified number of bytes.

      • state

        public abstract Segment.State state()
